figure_1.title: Figure 1.
figure_1.caption: Flow of participants through the study.

claims.sentence:
Study Population
Figure 1 shows the flow of participants through the study.

Study Outcomes
Figure 2 shows the cumulative percentage of participants in each of the two groups who enrolled in buprenorphine treatment during the study.
Incentive participants were significantly more likely to have enrolled in buprenorphine treatment by the end of the 6-month intervention than Control participants (Figure 2 and Table 2).

The percentage of buprenorphine-positive urine samples and methadone-positive urine samples was low and similar among participants in both groups at intake and throughout the intervention (Figure 3, top panels; Table 2).

The percentage of opiate-positive urine samples and fentanyl-positive urine samples was high and similar among participants in both groups at intake and throughout the intervention (Figure 3, bottom panels; Table 2).

Figure 3 shows the percentage of opioid-positive urine samples provided by participants in the two groups during the study.

The percentage of buprenorphine-positive urine samples and methadone-positive urine samples was low and similar among participants in both groups at intake and throughout the intervention (Figure 3, top panels; Table 2).

The percentage of opiate-positive urine samples and fentanyl-positive urine samples was high and similar among participants in both groups at intake and throughout the intervention (Figure 3, bottom panels; Table 2).
